title: Quantitative Analyst
jobDescription:
Open to remote employees ONLY in: OH, PA, MI, IN, KY, WV, WI, AL TN, GA, FL, TX, MO, SC, SD, NC, NE, SC, or SD. Employees located in OH will be required to come to the office one day every three weeks. 
We are looking for a Data Science Analyst who will support our product, sales, and marketing teams monetize data solutions. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization, and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.
Responsibilities:
Ability to analyze complex big data and create actionable insightsUses knowledge of business objectives, strategies, and needs to identify opportunities where data can be leveraged to achieve the desired business benefitsUnderstands current data context, processes and availability, and how current data processes and existing data can be leveraged to achieve the desired benefitsWork directly with Data Scientists on Machine Learning and AI projectsPerforms validation and testing to confirm the accuracy of the information createdInterprets results of analyses, identifies trends, and issues, and develops recommendations to support business objectivesCommunicates complex information so that it is easy to understand and influences others to take action based on the useful information providedFacilitate the design and development of product featuresInterview subject matter experts, customers, and other stakeholders to identify and clarify requirementsConduct stakeholder interviews to gather business requirements for model developmentWork closely with product owners, data scientists, data engineers to ensure clear definition of all requirements, translating them to user stories and use cases
Qualifications:
Healthcare revenue cycle experience with hospitals, providers, and/or other healthcare delivery organizations6+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst, Quantitative Analyst, or similarExperience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data setsKnowledge of a variety of machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques (clustering, decision tree, neural networks, etc.) and advantages/drawbacksDemonstrable knowledge of SQL, BI tools, and source controlExperience with big data platforms like Snowflake and AzureExceptional communicator and storyteller with a strong attention to detail

title: Data Scientist
jobDescription:
Airspace Data: Revolutionizing Aviation Efficiency
At Airspace Data, we leverage cutting-edge technology and innovative methodologies to optimize aviation routes, offering exclusive access to unused military airspace. Our solutions save time, reduce fuel consumption, and minimize CO2 emissions, driving efficiency and sustainability in the aviation industry.
Job Title: Data Scientist
Location: Chicago, Illinois or RemoteDepartment: Data ScienceReports to: Chief Data Officer
Position Overview
As a Data Scientist at Airspace Data, you will play a critical role in developing and implementing advanced data-driven solutions to optimize airspace utilization. You will work closely with a multidisciplinary team to enhance our product offerings, leveraging your expertise in data analysis, software development, and cloud technologies.
Basic Requirements
Education: Degree in a quantitative field (Data Science, Computer Science, Physics, Chemistry, etc.)Technical Skills:Familiarity with linear differential equationsProficiency in Python, particularly with numpy and pandas librariesAt least five years of coding experience in any languageUnderstanding of the basics of HTTP requestsExperience with version control systems and git branching strategiesProficiency in SQL, PySpark, or other relational database toolsExperience with the Linux command line
Preferred Requirements
In addition to meeting all the basic requirements, the ideal candidate will also have:
Education: Masters or higher in a quantitative field (Data Science, Computer Science, Physics, Chemistry, etc.)Technical Skills:Experience with AWS or other cloud-based software platformsProficiency in writing FastAPI code in PythonExperience in developing production software in a professional environmentFamiliarity with JavaScript and React
Key Responsibilities
Develop and implement data models and algorithms to optimize airspace routes.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data-driven solutions into our products.Analyze and interpret complex datasets to provide actionable insights.Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines and systems.Ensure data quality and integrity throughout the data lifecycle.Stay up to date with the latest advancements in data science and aviation technology.
Why Join Airspace Data?
At Airspace Data, we are at the forefront of transforming the aviation industry. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to work on a groundbreaking projects that have a real-world impact on efficiency and sustainability. We offer a collaborative and innovative work environment, competitive compensation, and opportunities for professional growth.
For more information about Airspace Data and to apply for this position, please visit our website at www.airspacedata.com.
